metadata.title: CVE-2019-17539 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
In FFmpeg before 4.2, avcodec_open2 in libavcodec/utils.c allows a NULLpointer dereference and possibly unspecified other impact when there is novalid close function pointer.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-17539` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:4.2.1-2
libavcodec-extra - 7:4.2.1-2
libavcodec-extra60 - 7:4.2.1-2
libavcodec60 - 7:4.2.1-2
libavdevice60 - 7:4.2.1-2
libavfilter-extra - 7:4.2.1-2
libavfilter-extra9 - 7:4.2.1-2
libavfilter9 - 7:4.2.1-2
libavformat-extra - 7:4.2.1-2
libavformat-extra60 - 7:4.2.1-2
libavformat60 - 7:4.2.1-2
libavutil58 - 7:4.2.1-2
libpostproc57 - 7:4.2.1-2
libswresample4 - 7:4.2.1-2
libswscale7 - 7:4.2.1-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:4.2.1-2').
